Control strains used for in vitro evaluation were the CLSI reference strains, including Candida albicans ATCC 2091, C. glabrata CBS 138, C. krusei ATCC 6258, C. parapsilosis ATCC 22019 and C. parapsilosis ATCC 90018. Additionally, numerous clinical isolates from the collection of EA1155 IICiMed were used: C. albicans ( n = 26), C. glabrata ( n = 12), C. krusei ( n = 14), C. parapsilosis ( n = 18) and C. tropicalis ( n = 6). The selected species are representative of the European epidemiology and therefore correspond to the five most prevalent species in the clinic settings
24 . Strains were maintained and subcultured 24 h before used on Sabouraud’s agar slants.
